_source.title: Area Operations Manager - Concrete - Springvale - Melbourne
_source.jobtitle: Area Operations Manager - Concrete - Springvale - Melbourne
_source.shortdescription: Fantastic opportunity for a senior candidate to lead and manage the South East Melbourne concrete business based out of our Springvale plant.
_source.jobaddetails:
About Holcim ANZ

As the new leader in the building materials industry, LafargeHolcim has the assets necessary to address the challenges of a new world. With 115,000 staff, a local presence in 90 countries, the most innovative cement, concrete, and aggregates solutions to meet our customers' needs, and a commitment to health, safety, and sustainability, we have the most efficient business model and the best performing operating models and teams.

Holcim ANZ has been integral in servicing Australia and NZ's infrastructure, construction and mining industries for more than 110 years under the well-known Readymix, Humes and Aggregates brands.  Holcim ANZ employs 3,000 staff and operates over 300 sites across both countries.

About the role

The Area Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing the safe production and maintenance for multiple concrete plants in the region whilst achieving safety targets through the implementation of Holcim SHE Management System, standards and objectives across the region.

Reporting to the Melbourne Concrete Manager, you will be an integral member of the management team. The position will predominantly be based at Holcim's Springvale plant however you will be required to travel to other sites in your region under your responsibility.

Responsibilities include

  • Achieving safety targets and ensuring acceptance and implementation of Holcim SHE Management System, standards and objectives across the region.
  • Developing a positive business culture through the demonstration and driving of targeted safety behaviours.
  • Ensuring all operations in the region comply with legal and environmental requirements including EPA license conditions.
  • Day to day management of operations across multiple plants - ensuring desired production levels are reached.
  • Operational improvement.
  • Profit and loss responsibility across your designated region.
  • Planning, budgeting and reporting across the region.
  • Ensuring all new and existing customer requirements are met.
  • Maintaining a high level of plant and fleet presentation / housekeeping.

About you

You're an established Operations Manager with a record of positive leadership across safety, operations and management.

You must be able to adapt to changing working environments and be able to make decisions under pressure.  

Other attributes we are interested to see include:

  • Demonstrated experience in a broad range of areas including production, cost management and business planning, people and contractor management.
  • A strong commitment to safety.
  • SAP and Command/Eagle Concrete software knowledge.
  • A commitment to providing excellent customer service.
  • Significant experience in the concrete industry will be a definite advantage.

Why join Holcim Australia?

  • We invest in the development of our people, providing great careers within the company both locally and globally. 
  • We have a great culture and people stay on average 8 years, with moves to new roles within the organisation occurring on average every 2-3 years. 
  • We are dedicated to being a good member of the communities we live and work in.
  • We are an organisation focussed on best practice across all parts of the business, and so we lead the industry in Safety Management, Environmental Sustainability, Sales Force effectiveness, and Operational efficiency

Find out where Holcim can take your career by applying today. 

 

For more information about this and other opportunities visit: http://www.holcim.com.au/careers.html

 

 

 

A permanent role in the world's largest building materials company Personal and professional development opportunities Great working environment and company culture

_source.title: Senior Contract Administrator required - Apartment Builder
_source.jobtitle: Senior Contract Administrator required - Apartment Builder
_source.shortdescription: MBA award winning apartment specialist requires an experienced Contract Administrator to oversee 2 x boutique apartment developments
_source.jobaddetails:
Our Client is a buoyant 2nd tier apartment specialist.  They are exceeding expectations and continuing to grow steadily. They are renowned for delivering high quality and high finish developments ranging in value from $5M - $30M.

Purely down to the level of work secured they are in need of a Senior Contract Administrator to oversee the financial element on two recently secured projects.  Both are D & C apartment developments totaling $25M in value.

 You will be responsible for all contracts to sub contractors, variations, scopes of works, along with cost reporting and programming with the PM.

 

The ideal candidate will:

  • Have completed a tertiary qualification in quantity surveying or construction/project management and have a minimum of 4 years experience in a similar role
  • Be a self starter capable of working without direction or micro- management
  • Be able to multi task effectively
  • Be well presented and an effective communicator
  • Possess excellent commercial awareness with strong relationship building, influencing and negotiating skills

In return you will be rewarded with a market leading salary starting at $110,000 - $130,000 dependent on experience from a company with a really positive culture who give complete support to all its employees from the very top right down.

If you are interested in this position or any similar please email your CV in word format to Jono Conley at Constructive Recruitment via the links below

$110,000 - $130,000

_source.title: Bill of Quantity Estimator
_source.shortdescription: Opportunity to work for Australia's leading builder in a team that empowers working as our Bill of Quantity Estimator in Head Office Mount Waverley.
_source.jobaddetails:
Metricon Homes, a leading multi award winning new home builder is committed to recruiting outstanding individuals who share our passion for delivering quality, service and award winning living solutions for Australian families.

This is a highly challenging but rewarding role located in Mount Waverley within the busy National Operations team.

Reporting to the BOQ Team Leader, your responsibilities will include:
  • BOQ Estimates on our new range of products and assisting in enhancing and developing the overall estimating system for the company;
  • Cost estimates for the Design Department for new release and prototype homes;
  • Production estimating for Display Homes; and
  • Ensuring relationships with internal and external customers, supervisors, suppliers, trades people, agents and contractors are maintained and improved.

Metricon will offer you:
  • A competitive salary and salary package opportunities;
  • Genuine career advancement opportunities;
  • Generous housing discounts on our award winning homes; and
  • A supportive workplace culture where great work is recognised and rewarded.

The successful candidate will have:
  • Some experience in an estimating role, preferably within the volume home building industry;
  • A qualification in Building / Construction and / or trade experience is highly desirable;
  • Have a high ability level to interpret, understand and communicate working drawings together with construction detail drawings;
  • Superior / highly developed interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Exposure to estimating systems such as Timberline will be advantageous;
  • Intermediate Microsoft WORD and EXCEL computer skills;
  • Working experience using Timberline would be an advantage;
  • Highly organised – ability to multi-task and deal with a variety of activities;
  • Working knowledge of the building and construction process; and
  • Possess a “Can Do Attitude” with the ability to be “Coachable”.

Don't forget to check out our Metricon Careers page on Facebook for more opportunities & insights

https://www.facebook.com/metriconcareers/?fref=ts Fun and Supportive Team Network Fast Paced Environment Onsite Parking, Gym and Cafe

_source.title: Project Manager-Building / Civils- global project services firm
_source.jobtitle: Project Manager-Building / Civils- global project services firm
_source.shortdescription: Project manager required for property construction project services company building projects from $500k- $5m
_source.jobaddetails:
Project manager required for property construction project services company building projects from $500k- $5m

Your new company
Our client is a global property construction brand that has a project management arm to deliver a range of diverse projects. They are a well respected brand name and currently require 2x project managers to deliver a scope of works, both civil and buildings.

Your new role
You will be responsible for essentially managing the projects from start to finish. These projects will range between $500k- $5m. They will be everything from building works, and civil works, living accommodation, services etc. You will liaise with the client and oversee contractors, subbies and builders. Strong construction experience is essential.

What you'll need to succeed
All requirements must be met.
You will have a construction qualification. Degree in construction management or engineering. You must be a strong communicator. You will have a minimum of 6 years experience. 2 years in project management. You will have experience in delivering projects such as building works or smaller scale civil works. Similar sized projects, not billion dollar projects. Your project experience must be similar. You must be based here in Melbourne ready to start. You must have local Victorian experience working for ideally a contractor and a consultancy. Your knowledge of onsite construction must be second to none.

What you'll get in return
You will be working for a brand name. You will a pipeline of projects that will keep you engaged no end. CBD offices. Salary range from $100k- $140k + super

What you need to do now
This is genuinely a fantastic opportunity to join a fantastic organisation. For further information please contact stewart.peutherer@hays.com.au or call 03 8616 8491

_source.title: Senior Project Engineer - Civil/ Utilities
_source.shortdescription: Our client is a growing Civil Contractor providing high quality projects to a variety of clients throughout Victoria.
_source.jobaddetails:
Our client is a busy mid tier Civil Contractor based in the south east of Melbourne providing integrated civil solutions to a variety of clients throughout Victoria.
 
Due to recent increase in work across the board in their business, they now require an experienced Project Manager/ Senior Project Engineer specialising in civil infrastructure works with exposure to civil road, rail and water projects up to $20mill. To be considered for this role the successful candidate must have over 5+ years experience working on similar projects within the Melbourne civil market.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Manage the effective, efficient and successful execution of trade packages and overall build
  • Report into the Director any issues around constructibility and methodology 
  • Ensure all works are carried out in compliance with relevant codes and standards
  • Strong implementation of cost control, cost forecast and time deliverables.
  • Manage mentor the team of Engineers
  • Ensure compliance with current OH&S guidelines
  • Overall responsibility for project programme
  • Tendering projects and business development
  • Overseeing contract management 
  • Excellent stakeholder management
Key Requirements:
  • A Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering
  • Minimum 5+ years Project Management/ Engineering experience working on Civil, rail, water infrastructure projects
  • Excellent understanding of underground services, bulk earthworks, road, rail and pipeline construction.
  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Strong leadership and man management skills
  • A track record working for major contractors on Melbourne projects
This organisation has an excellent culture that promotes a strong team based environment. The successful candidate will be offered a competitive salary with the chance to develop their career into a senior management role.
 
To apply please click the apply now button or alternatively send an update CV to brendan.redwood@fetchrecruit.com.au 

Or call me on 0410 344 366 for a confidential discussion regarding this role or other opportunities.
 
Great opportunity for career progression Diverse range of projects Projects across metro Melbourne $100,000 - $130,000 + Super + Vehicle

_source.title: Supervisor
_source.shortdescription: Site Supervisor required to work for a reputable Volume Home Builder in Melbourne's Metro South area.
_source.jobaddetails:
My client, a reputable Volume Builder in Melbourne is looking to add a Site Supervisor to their Metro South Region. We are recruiting this role due to continued growth in this region. The expectation is that with the current pipeline, this growth will continue and will provide opportunities for career progression within the business. You will be managing anywhere between 10-15 sites at any one time.

Although my client is a volume builder they pride themselves on their family values and beliefs and take immense pleasure in ensuring the happiness of their staff and having a great retention rate.

As the Site Supervisor, you will be responsible for managing the construction of Residential Projects from Inception to completion which will include:
  • Managing multiple sites in Melbourne's Metro South area
  • Working closely with your Construction Manager as part of the senior leadership team
  • Working closely with clients during the construction process to ensure the company standard of customer service.
  • Managing trades on site to ensure a positive and effective trade relationship is maintained.
To be considered for the role of Site Supervisor you will require:
  • Multiple years' experience as a Site Manager working on volume homes in Melbourne.
  • Great understanding of OH & S and a desire to have a safe work site.
  • Proven ability to coordinate projects on time and within budget.
  • A good understanding of the local market and a solid trade base in the area.
Design & Build specializes in recruitment for the Construction, Engineering & Property industries on a national basis. Design & Build prides itself on only hiring recruitment specialists, finding the right people for the right jobs and doing the right thing by both job seekers and employers alike. 

For any questions relating to this role or other opportunities with D&B and our clients please contact Andrew King on (03) 8535 3100 or click apply. Your application will be treated as strictly confidential. 

Thanks for your consideration. Reputable Volume Home Builder Projects are varied and exciting with the ability to plan your own days Excellent company culture with a tight-knit team and solid management $110K + Super + Vehicle

_source.title: Capital Works Project Manager - Health
_source.shortdescription: Client side role where you will manage a range of capital works projects within the health sector
_source.jobaddetails:
Our client is a well-known and highly regarded group who specialise in the delivery of major and minor capital works projects within the healthcare sector. With an increase in projects confirmed for FY 17/18, this group are looking to add a Project Manager to their team.
  
As Project Manager you will play a lead role in the management of capital works projects from brief development through to completion across fit-out, refurbishment, relocation and major new-build projects. You will be responsible for extensive stakeholder engagement to develop project briefs and preparing and presenting business cases to senior management. Key to your success in this role will be an ability to manage a diverse team of consultants and manage the builder to ensure that key project milestones are achieved.  
  
The ideal candidate for this role will have the following experience / skill-set:
  • Proven track record in the delivery of built form projects on the Eastern Seaboard
  • Minimum 6 years of experience as a Project Manager for a Consultancy or Client Side Organisation
  • Tertiary qualifications in Architecture, Engineering or Construction.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  • Exposure to healthcare projects will be highly regarded
Opportunity for a Project Management professional to join a growing organisation with an on-going project pipeline. Work with link minded individuals in a highly collaborative environment where you will deliver a diverse range of major and minor capital projects. Attractive salary package with strong scope for career growth.

_source.jobaddetails:

Client Details

Our client is a leading Development/Project Manager firm that has a well-established and highly respected leadership team in Melbourne. They are currently moving into a period of continual growth having recently secured a number of high profile projects in and around the Melbourne CBD and as a result are seeking an experienced.

With one of the industry’s most highly regarded senior leadership teams who work alongside a very strong and capable development team who are continuing to build and foster relationships with major clients which has resulted in the securing of new development opportunities and repeat client work.

Description

As a Client Side Project Manager, you will be responsible for full life-cycle project management including stakeholder management, scope definition, business case development, feasibility, planning, design and delivery.

You will be managing project scopes, ensuring the project is delivered on time and to budget whist achieving all project objectives

Profile

The successful candidate will have several years' construction and project management experience in the building industry. A tertiary qualification in construction, building or engineering is essential. You will also require excellent communication skills, commercial acumen and of critical importance will be a pro-active and client focused approach.

Job Offer

In return you will receive a market leading salary package as well as an opportunity to work for an employer that wants to develop and grow its staff to become great leaders.

To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply Now' button below. For a confidential discussion, please contact Matthew Love on 0422 290 712.

_source.title: Services Coordinator
_source.shortdescription: Work for a one of Melbourne's leading construction businesses on this $60M commercial project!
_source.jobaddetails:
• Well respected and established national property group
  • Exciting and varied projects
  • Genuine leadership and growth opportunities

Client Details

Our client is a leading national property group that has a well-established and highly respected brand in Melbourne. They have a reputation for their passion and for delivering a quality product for their clients.

They have mixed and diverse portfolio having delivered projects across residential, commercial, education, health and the government sectors.

Throughout the last 10 years they have recruited and developed many of Melbourne's most experienced construction leaders who are some of the most highly respected Construction Managers in the industry.

Description

Reporting to the Project Manager, you will have responsibility for managing services trades, design, QA, EHS and financial aspects on this $60m commercial project. The role would suit someone looking for autonomy, development and a career growth path from their employer, as well as the opportunity to develop their leadership skills under some fantastic mentors with a view to move into management role in the near future.

Profile

With a background working for a commercial builder or subcontractor in Melbourne you will have managed services packages on $50M+ commercial projects, as well you having exceptional subcontractor management, communication and interpersonal skills, along with the ability to work autonomously.

Job Offer

In return you will receive a market leading salary package as well as an opportunity to work for an employer that has consistently proven to focus on staff development and looking after its people.

For a further discussion please contact Matthew Love on (03) 8547 1343 or email matthewlove@future-you.com.au

To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply Now' button below. For a confidential discussion, please contact Matthew Love on 0422 290 712.

Right now, they are looking for a proven Project Engineer with strong Mechanical and HVAC experience within the Melbourne building and construction market.  This role will see you display your experience in the delivery of large scale commercial projects.

To be successful in this role you will have:

_source.title: Site Manager - Tier 2 Commercial Builder
_source.shortdescription: Site Manager - Tier 2 Commercial Builder- CBD Location- Diverse range of projects to $60M- Work Life Balance!
_source.jobaddetails:
Site Manager - Tier 2 Commercial Builder- CBD Location- Diverse range of projects to $60M- Work Life Balance!

A reputable Tier 2 Commercial Builder have experienced significant year on year growth and are continuing to grow. This well-established builder have effectively delivered a diverse range of projects including Health, Education, Commercial and Institutional projects over the past 40 years. With continuous strategies to expand well under way, several positions have now become available, including a permanent Site Manager position.

You will be responsible for the Site Management of a range of projects valued between $10M and $40M. To begin with, you will look after a $20M Health project, therefore experience on commercial projects to $20M is a requirement for this position. As Site Manager, you will be responsible for conducting toolbox meetings, ensuring OH&S and quality standards are met, coordinating trades and working alongside the Project Manager to ensure the efficient management of day to day operations.

You will have 2+ years of local Melbourne experience with a Tier 2 or Tier 3 builder, with experience delivering projects up to $20M in value. Trade qualifications in building combined with strong communication and time management skills, attention to detail and an excellent work ethic are essential for this role.

In return, you will be joining one of the most dynamic and professionally operated builders in the industry. This team of professionals truly value their staff, resulting in low turnover rates and a positive, stimulating working environment. This is a genuine, long term opportunity to join a stable organisation with big plans for the future.

For a confidential discussion regarding this role or any similar positions that may be available, please contact Charlotte Baker on 03 8616 8491 or email your resume in word format to Charlotte.baker@hays.com.au

_source.title: Estimator - Luxury High End Homes
_source.shortdescription: A multi award winning luxury home builder in Melbourne is seeking a full time Estimator to join their well established team.
_source.jobaddetails:
The Company

A multi award winning luxury home builder in Melbourne is seeking an Estimator to join their well established team. Our client boasts a friendly, stable family style working environment for all employees. This role is unique in the fact that the successful candidate will be exposed to all areas of the business!

The Role

You will be working alongside both the Construction Manager and the Director. As the Estimator your key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Production and BOQ estimating
  • Raising Purchase Orders and negotiating with suppliers and sub contractors
  • Construction programming
  • Administration duties and some CA work (variations etc)

The Candidate

To be successful in securing this unique opportunity, you will have:

  • Tertiary and /or trade qualificarion in building
  • Min 3 years of experience in a similar role
  • Strong computer skills including Databuild and MS office
  • Good technical understanding of complex high end residential construction
  • Impressive communication skills and proven ability to meet strict deadlines.

The Rewards

A generous salary package is on offer for the right candidate and we can offer an immediate start. If you believe you meet the above criteria, please "APPLY" attaching both your CV and a cover letter. For a confidential discussion about the role please call Michael on 0403932540 or Graeme on 0417344298. Due to the expected high volume of applicants only successful candidates will be notified.

Impressive salary package on offer

_source.title: Project Manager
_source.shortdescription: Project Managers wanted to work on multi million dollar education, health and aged care projects here in Melbourne.
_source.jobaddetails:
Located in the heart of the CBD, our client is a highly sought after Project Management Consultancy offering specialist advisory services across the health, aged care, education, aviation, commercial and infrastructure sectors.  With representation across all states, nationally they have a strong pipeline of projects and now seek to bring on another Project Manager to join their Melbourne team.

As a Project Manager you will be working alongside a Senior on a mix of iconic projects to the value of $40 million.  You will be responsible for assisting the Project team on full life-cycle project management duties including business case development, feasibility, planning, design and delivery on major projects in Victoria.
  
To be considered for this position you will be expected to have:
• Minimum 2- 4 years of either Project Management, Engineering, Construction or Commercial/Business Experience.
• Experience managing early stages including master planning, stakeholder management, consultant engagement.

This client will also consider candidates looking to move client side from builder / contractor side.

You will be provided with an excellent salary, ongoing training and work with a management team that are supportive, professional and reward their team for their efforts.  This is also a company that prefers to promote from within.
 
Design & Build specialises in recruitment for the Property, Mining, Construction & Engineering industries on a regional and national basis. Design & Build prides itself on only hiring recruitment specialists, finding the right people for the right jobs and doing the right thing by both jobseekers and employers alike.

If you feel your experience matches the person specification or you would like to discuss this and other opportunities we have available within Project Management and Development please contact Monique Assaw on 03 8535 3100 / 0421 604 838 or click apply. Please note only short listed candidates will be contacted and your application will be treated as strictly confidential.

_source.title: Demolition Excavator Operator
_source.shortdescription: Demolition Excavator Operator
_source.jobaddetails:
Experienced Demolition Excavator Operator required.  You must be experienced in sifting and using a hydrulic thumb.  Experience in demolishing houses is essential.  You will be working for a Demolition company that knocks down 25 houses a month.

You will be expected to be able to knock down a brick veneer house and clear the site leaving bear dirt from corner to corner groomed and track rolled, in a safe, clean and timely fashion.

Company ute, feul card, PPE and uniform supplied

3 months casual the full time

Pay will start at $35.00 an hour and go up from there depending on how quickly you can clear jobs, how clean you leave them and how little damage you cause.

Working mon-fri 40-50 hours a week, working from Portsea to St Kilda and out to Doncaster

NO TEXTING

$35 - $49.99 per hour

_source.title: Senior Project Manager
_source.shortdescription: Plan and manage multiple Infrastructure Projects in support of the OneSKY program
_source.jobaddetails:
The Organisation

Airservices is a government owned organisation providing safe, secure, efficient and environmentally responsible services to the aviation industry. Each year we manage over four million aircraft movements carrying more than 140 million passengers, and provide air navigation services across 11 per cent of the world’s airspace. Airservices has two major operating centres in Melbourne and Brisbane and a corporate office in Canberra. We operate 29 air traffic control towers at international and regional airports, and provide aviation rescue fire fighting services at 26 Australian airports.

The Role

The OneSKY Australia Program is responsible for the planning, development and implementation of Airservices next generation services including the future civil-military air traffic management system (CMATS) through the Program – a joint activity with the Department of Defence.

The Senior Project Manager, Infrastructure Projects, works as part of a joint team combining Airservices and Department of Defence personnel. The role will be responsible for the planning and execution of multiple Infrastructure Projects in support of the OneSKY program. The major portfolio responsibility includes design and construct of Air Traffic Control Service Centres (ATSC) across Australia.

One position is in Brisbane managing the Northern portfolio (Brisbane ATSC) and the Melbourne position manages the Southern portfolio (Melbourne and Perth ATSC). The role will be required to work across the organisation ensuring timely delivery of the allocated portfolio.

These roles will be offered on a three year fixed term period.

The Person

You will be an integral part of the OneSKY Australia Program team as a high-performing and accountable team member. Your role is to work autonomously ensuring a consistent understanding of financial deliverables is achieved and the financial frameworks are kept up to date and enhanced within the program.

Skills and Experience

The successful applicant will have:

  • Demonstrated skills in leading a dynamic team and driving project outcomes
  • Ability to manage projects within the Industrial and Construction sector
  • In-depth understanding of project delivery methodologies
  • Extensive experience clearly articulating project progress, risks, issues and outcomes in support of board updates and engagement with other governance and oversight functions
  • Industrial and Construction Contract and vendor management expertise
  • Stakeholder management and influencing skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a matrixed organisation, drawing on other program capabilities (e.g. program assurance, transition planning and logistics
  • Must be an Australian Citizen with a Baseline Clearance (PROTECTED or NV1 or ability to obtain)

Please see the link below to view the full Position Description and information about holding a security clearance below:

http://defence.gov.au/agsva/FAQ/clearance-subject.asp

PD - Senior Project Manager_Infrastructure.pdf

Should you require any further information please contact Greg Houghton on 03 9339 2642 or greg.houghton@airservicesaustralia.com

How to Apply

To apply for this position please lodge an application online via the “apply link” attaching your resume and a cover letter outlining your skills and experience and how they relate to this role.

Applications close 11.55pm (AEST) Monday 12th June 2017

Please refer to the security check requirements successful applicants will be required to undertake as part of the recruitment process. Airservices is a government owned corporation providing the aviation industry with services such as air traffic control, navigation facilities and aviation rescue and fire fighting.

Airservices values social and cultural diversity and is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and the provision of a safe and healthy work environment.

In the interests of safety, we test for alcohol and other drugs

Unique Program to harmonise Civil & Military Air Traffic Control Provide strategic guidance Lead, coach, develop, and retain a high-performance team Salary package to be negotiated

_source.title: Urgent Labourers/Concreters/Steelfixers/Formworkers Wanted
_source.shortdescription: We are currently seeking Labourers/Concreters/Steelfixers/Formworkers
_source.jobaddetails:
About the Positions

We are seeking experienced Civil Construction Labourers/Concreters/Steelfixer and Formworkers. These positions are for an ongoing projects where skilled Labourers will be offered long term employment based on exceptional work performance.

We are seeking:

  • Extensive Construction employment history with demonstrated Concrete experience
  • Experience with screeding to exposed aggregrate is essential
  • Residential/Commercial and Industrial projects experience; thorough capability in pouring residential concrete slabs for both small and large scale works, including quality concrete placement and finish
  • The ability to clearly communicate, self motivate and contribute to safety compliance and culture
  • Willingness to assist others to promote an environment of teamwork and achieve common goals
  • Must have relevant tickets/qualifications
  • Will pass National Police Clearance and Pre-Employment Medical inc. Drug and Alcohol screening
  • Committed to long term employment commencing in the immediate  future

How to Apply

If you meet the above criteria please APPLY NOW

Immediate start Ongoing opportunities available Exciting project

_source.title: Production Estimator , Experienced in Databuild
_source.shortdescription: Singh Homes is seeking for self-motivated Experienced Quantity/ Production Estimator to oversee all facets of the Residential Building Estimating
_source.jobaddetails:
Production Estimator , Experienced in Databuild

 

* Epping Location

* Permanent Full Time Position

* Great Package

 

Singh Homes is seeking for self-motivated Experienced Quantity/ Production Estimator to oversee all facets of the Residential Building Estimating Division. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, have the ability to work autonomously, have a strong attention to detail, and be looking for a long term career. The successful applicant will have at least 3 years' experience in an Estimating role.

 

A strong understanding of the construction process is required. Databuild experience is essential

 

The Role:

As a Production Estimator based in our Northern Suburbs head office, you will working directly with the directors and will be required to quote for projects and BOQ's. You will set prices based on supplier rates and schedules, calculate quantities and liaise with the Architects, Site Supervisors and the customers. Will be responsible for full estimation of custom jobs .The software you will be using is Data build. Previous experience in Data build is a must.

 

Skills & Experience

•          Minimum 3 years in experience in production estimating in construction industry.

•          Strong understanding of workflow stages in the Custom Home building industry

•          Thorough Understanding of construction, techniques, terminology & costs

•          Understanding of doing Cost Estimates for highly customised houses

•          Ability to proactively drive an outcome working collaboratively with both internal & external stakeholders

•          Proficient in adding recipes in data build as and when required.

 

     To apply, simply send your CV to info@singhhomes.com.au
